DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective of the CORDIA study is to use an effective evidence-based self-management intervention (SMI) for type 2 diabetes, with and without a novel test to give a personalised genetic and lifestyle risk of coronary heart disease, to examine their capacity to reduce the risk of coronary heart disease (CHD) and improve diabetes management in primary care patients with type 2 diabetes. The effect of these interventions on clinical, behavioural and psychological outcomes will be investigated.
DOC.brief_title: Coronary Heart Disease Risk in Type 2 Diabetes
